meanings.def: one of the various types of powder or seed that come from plants and are used in cooking. Spices have a strong taste and smell.
examples: common spices such as ginger and cinnamon
We need an exciting trip to add some spice to our lives.
The danger added spice to their romance.

meanings.def: a powerful illegal synthetic (= artificial) drug that some people smoke for the physical and mental effects that it has on them
examples: Six men overdosed on the synthetic drug known as spice.

meanings.def: having a range of different experiences makes life more interesting

idioms.idiom: variety is the spice of life
idioms.def: having a range of different experiences makes life more interesting

related: variety is the spice of life

meanings.def: to add spice to food in order to give it more taste
examples: I don't really like highly spiced food.
Their bread is spiced with cinnamon.
a dish of lightly spiced rice

meanings.def: to add interest or excitement to something
examples: He exaggerated the details to spice up the story.
Her conversation is always spiced with humour.
